snippet: President Obama once ran on hope. Now he needs to spend more time persuading dubious and disillusioned voters how he is going to achieve his goals.
abstract: Editorial assesses Pres Obama's first formal re-election campaign speech; appreciates Obama's goals but contends more time must be spent persuading dubious and disillusioned voters that he can achieve those goals; urges Obama to remind voters how far backward Mitt Romney and his party would take the country.
lead_paragraph: President Obama once ran on hope. Now he needs to spend more time persuading dubious and disillusioned voters how he is going to achieve his goals.
